page.title: 01Headley & Lindford
page.content: The region is one of undulating countryside which, in its woodland cover, still reflects the great forest of Woolmer which once covered the landscape. Th River Wey is a dominant feature, not far from its source and relatively unpopulated. Perhaps in the not too distant future, this feature will provide an attractive leisure facility for the residents. More than half the land in the two parishes is given over to residential development. There is considerable local concern in case this process continues to engulf more of our lovely countryside and to overwhelm the already stretched amenities. The remaining land with its thin soil is given over to farming, mainly small scale endeavours, mostly devoted to grazing cattle. There is little industrial
